bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, July 5, 1940

div1.p: Kean is upset over efforts to get Poucher's name added to the Yellow Fever Roll of Honor.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, July 5, 1940
div1.opener:
MRS. J.R. KEAN
2804 N STREET, N. W.
WASHINGTON, D. C.
TELEPHONE DECATUR 0478
July 5, 1940
My dear Dr Hench
div1.p:
Yours of the 25th ult arrived
on June 27th which happened to be
my 80th birthday. When I get the questions
which you are going to write down and
send me the questions which you have
in mind I will see if I can round
up a stenographer and dictate the
replies with the 2 or 3 extra copies
as you request. I have been much
annoyed recently by an extraordinary
occurrence. An old friend Col. A.G.
Love M. C. at the Surgeon General's
office called me in the phone and
asked if I had ever heard of a Dr.
J. Wilson Poucher of Pougkeepsie N.Y.
in connection with Walter Reed's Yellow
fever experiments in New York Cuba.
I said I had recently occasion to get
his military record at the request of
a mutual friend but that he had no
connection with Reed or his experiments
Col. Love then said that Col. Hamilton Fish
AC
K
2
Congressman from New York had introduced
a bill to have the name of J. Wilson
Poucher inserted into the Act of Feb. 28, 1929
creating the yellow fever Roll of Honor to
appear immediately after the name of
Johns J. Moran, that Act to be amended
accordingly. I could not believe my
ears and exclaimed that Poucher had
nothing on earth to do with that great
episode and was not in the service
at that time or as far as I knew in
Cuba !! I asked Col. Love to send me
a copy of the Act which he did.
Can you imagine such a monstrous
proposition? There have been many
efforts to get on to that list, but none
quite as monstrous as this. I have
written to the mutual friend to make
inquiries and he informs me that Dr.
Poucher is a nice old man and is
entirely innocent in this matter, and
makes no claim to having had any-
thing to do with the Walter Reed epi-
sode but his friends are sorry for him
and have got Col. Fish to do this to
help him. Can you imagine anything so
absolutely irresponsible and fraudulent!
The Surgeon General has reported to the
Adjutant General that there is no evidence
3
MRS. J.R. KEAN
2804 N STREET, N. W.
WASHINGTON, D. C.
TELEPHONE DECATUR 0478
that Dr. Poucher ever had and con-
nection with the Reed investigation,
but it is not certain that this will
kill it, unless one member of the
Military Committee of the House takes
it up and sees that the Committee is
informed as to the facts.

This is a queer and crazy world, isnt
it. You know dont you that the Yellow
Fever Roll of Honor is published each
year in the Army Register with a
statement as to what each man did
in connection with it.
